snippet: Scientists have discovered that fairywren mothers teach their unborn chicks a unique begging call to differentiate them from cuckoos invading her nest.
abstract: Dr Mark Hauber study in journal Current Biology finds that the fairywren, an Australian bird species, teaches its unborn chicks a unique begging call to differentiate them from cuckoo chicks invading their nest.
lead_paragraph: Scientists have discovered that fairywren mothers teach their unborn chicks a unique begging call to differentiate them from cuckoos invading her nest.

headline.print_headline: Birds Learn ‘Password’ To Sing for Their Supper
headline.seo: Australian Fairywren Teaches Chicks a ‘Password’ Call
headline.main: Birds Learn ‘Password’ to Sing for Their Supper
